report_title: Industry Report on Major Smart Appliance Manufacturers
executive_summary: Major smart appliance manufacturers build smart household cooking appliances, refrigerators and laundry equipment. Rising millennial home ownership and increasing disposable income in developed economies are poised to drive automated home demand. A boom in the number of internet connections has skyrocketed demand for industry products. High input prices provided new revenue streams for manufacturers during the recovery from COVID-19, as companies passed on high costs to consumers. Interest rates have soared in recent years, as the Federal Reserve has been combatting inflation. This has raised the cost of borrowing, reducing downstream demand from the housing market and hindered revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Conditions of the Pandemic Present a Unique Growth Opportunity for Home Automation Services
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The increasing embrace of the internet-of-things was expedited during the pandemic, as remote work prompted consumers with discretionary spending to contract home automation services. As internet connections continue to proliferate, more aspects of home life are automated, expanding companies' product portfolios and enabling them to tap into new markets. While the pandemic boosted demand for smart devices that reduce face-to-face exposure and boost safety, it also significantly disrupted the semiconductor chip supply. Industry enterprises depend on semiconductor chips as a key industry input, so inflated prices have pressured profitability.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Home Automation Has Become an Integral Part of the Luxury Home Experience
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A plethora of investment activity in research and development has enabled home automation technology to expand the scope of its applications. Many consumers have increasingly adopted home automation services to make their homes more energy-efficient, convenient, and secure. Security features and internet connectivity have become essential in luxury homes, and higher-income markets represent the largest share of industry-wide revenue. While the industry has a strong foothold with younger demographics and struggles to catch up with retirees, a growing widespread acceptance and normalization of smart homes will benefit the industry going forward.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Residential Markets Return to Growth, Enlivening Demand for Home Automation Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Investment in residential construction, which high mortgage rates have siphoned away, will be rejuvenated, creating a market of new homeowners that home automation services can cater to. The widespread adoption of remote work has enabled the industry to leverage a steady stream of demand from home professionals, leading to demand for homes with pre-built automation services. Even as a renter's market has sapped demand away from new residential construction, the industry has adapted to cater to a Gen Z demographic who may find products less affordable, but are simultaneously better equipped to embrace the technology behind them.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry Profitability is Boosted by Input Price Depression
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The price of semiconductors will normalize from previous highs brought on by supply chain disruptions during the pandemic. As the recently passed CHIPS Act bolsters semiconductor chip manufacturing, industry enterprises will encounter greater profitability as they incur less strenuous input costs. Industry enterprises strategically invest in optimizing user experiences with advancements from smart lighting to increased security services. Major players will acquire small and local home automation providers to gain expertise and expand customer reach. Amplification in product offerings and geographical presence through collaborations and partnerships is slated to bolster the market share of the more prominent industry enterprises.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry provide services to automate home appliances, climate control and other aspects of home living spaces.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Number of mobile internet connections
threats: Price of semiconductor and electronic components

key_trends: Skyrocketing mobile internet connections have led to surging demand for home automation services, which has benefited the industry by heightening consumer spending.
As home automation services have become less expensive and more accessible, more consumers have started to use them, boosting revenue growth.

Smart appliances can collect personal data, such as usage patterns and preferences. Since consumers care about protecting their private information, there are significant regulations on collecting and sharing this data.

A boom in internet connections has enabled the industry to expand in unison. Similarly, increased private investment in computers and software and high levels of consumer spending injected life into the industry.
Wealthy consumers who purchase home automation services are less sensitive to prices, so industry enterprises can pass on the high costs of inputs to their buyers, raising their revenue.
The industry has adapted to cater to a younger, less income-rich demographic better equipped to embrace the technology behind the industry's offerings.

Despite the prominence of global companies such as Resideo, which joined with giant Honeywell International, that capture large swathes of the market, enterprise growth has been burgeoning as more new entrants look to capitalize on surging demand.
High barriers to entry increase market share concentration. Starting a home automation company is costly, as it requires extensive investment in technology, raw materials and workers.
Rising wage and purchase costs have pressured industry profitability, which has experienced volatility despite consistent revenue growth.
Rising input prices from semiconductor chip disruptions and hikes in home appliance prices have driven up industry purchase costs.

market_segmentation.segment: Consumers in the Upper-Income Quartile Represent the Bulk of the Industry's Market
market_segmentation.segment_description: Following the logic that the industry ebbs and flows according to discretionary income and consumer spending levels, it's evident that consumers with more disposable income would be the most prominent market for home automation services. Consumers with income at or above $200,000 currently account for one of the largest percentages of industry revenue, totaling over 20.0%.

products_and_services.product_description: Security systems products are the most popular use for home automation services. This product range offers sensors, cameras, locks, and chiefly smart doorbells, all for the security.
Energy management products such as HVAC controls, smart thermostats, smart meters, and smart plugs enable consumers to monitor the electricity consumption within a household.

Cleaning products include robotic vacuum cleaners as well as smart mops and other smart appliances such as dishwashers. These products are increasingly utilizing ultraviolet light for disinfection purposes.
Lighting services such as dimmers, timers, switches, and sensors enable homeowners to check the lighting within the household from any location.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: AIR AND ENERGY SYSTEMS GROW IN POPULARITY AS ENERGY EFFICIENCY CONCERNS INTENSIFY
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Energy management products such as HVAC controls, smart thermostats, smart meters, and smart plugs enable consumers to monitor the electricity consumption within a household. As environmental consciousness spreads and the push for green infrastructure grows, home automation services are investing in and promoting solar energy integration products and other energy storage and monitoring solutions to target this growing market.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Input Costs Inflate as Semiconductor Disruptions and Home Appliance Price Hikes Mount
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Recent rises in the price of semiconductors have caused industry enterprises to incur hefty purchase costs and cut into profitability.

While purchase costs have declined as a share of revenue, the price of inputs has remained relatively volatile. To this end, a rise in the price of certain input products, like semiconductor chips, tends to benefit industry revenue, as higher prices translate to higher revenue.
The industry overall is subject to raw material price fluctuations, and events such as the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict contribute to purchase cost volatility.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is adding new patent technologies at a rate in line with the average across all industries, which suggests a stable addition of technology. However, the concentration of technologies is high. This creates the potential for innovation outside the focus of industry leaders to gain traction.

The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Housing market behavior dictates industry growth
volatility_points.volatility_description: Higher interest rates reduce homebuying, as the cost of borrowing is a major determinant of whether individuals decide to purchase property each year. Rates have fluctuated amid high inflation because of the actions of the Federal Reserve, so they have increased volatility for the industry. Since homes are often installed with smart appliances, fewer homes being purchased inhibit downstream demand.

As incomes rise, consumers use more money to purchase luxuries, such as home automation services, benefiting the industry. Income growth has shifted significantly during the current period because of the pandemic and the ensuing economic recovery, creating more revenue volatility.
